course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Internet Applications Development
course.description: This course intends to cover Internet applications development through programming. Major topics include object-oriented development approaches, advanced GUI building blocks, networking and database connectivity and so on.  Students will learn and practice a high-level programming language for the implementation of practical Internet applications.
course.exclusions: COMP 1022P, COMP 3021

reviews.author: Luke98
reviews.comment_content: It is called Internet Application Programmig, but everything is about Java programming. The contents cover everything from very basic things. Even though there are no prerequisites, the professor recommended us to have any programming experience before, and I also recommend it too. I took this course after COMP1021, and felt the level of this course not too difficult and not too easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good. The professor speaks very clearly, and explains everything from very basic things to a little bit advanced things.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 Assignments 20%
2 In-class Quizzes 30%
Group Project (Mini-game) 35%
Attendance (Lab) 15%

Even though the final project counts a big part of the grade, 65% of the grade is on individual base.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to complete 2 assignments and a final project. These are essential parts of the course. If you take this course in winter, you have to devote almost everyday to this course, according to the professor. However, if you are very smart, you can finish each assignment in a day.

reviews.author: KenNg
reviews.title: Not a good option for IS Major required course
reviews.comment_content:
There are three main parts in this course
1. Beginners concepts on Jave language
2. Object-Oriented Programming
3. Developing Applications Using JavaFX

If you do not have any programming experience, you will have a hard time catching up on the amount of knowledge for each lecture.

The first two parts are useful if you really need to learn the Java language but the third part JavaFX is something that I think is outdated content.
You will need to form a group to build an interactive application program which really depends on your team.

Most importantly the technique you have learned will probably never be used again as not one use JavaFX to build applications nowadays.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Muller Cheung is kind and willing to give responses and answers to questions.
But he will mainly stick on the slides(maybe the course nature is this)
His English is clear and easy to understand (just pronunciation of some words are weird)
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab submission - 20%
Individual assignment (2 in total) - 40%
Group project (JavaFX) - 40%

The Lab submission needs to be submitted after the Lab within an hour, so you basically need to take every lab.
The first assignment is relatively easy, only about the basic concepts but it still takes days to complete as a beginner.
The second assignment is much difficult and you need to have a great understanding on object-oriented programming in order to finish the assignment.

My grade for reference
lab submission - 17.5/20
Individual assignment 1 - 19/20
Individual assignment 2 - 13/20
Group project - 34.8/40
Final grade - B
reviews.comment_workload:
Tons of workload.
Assignments take days.
The project takes weeks.
Make sure you are OK with coding and find good teammates.

reviews.title: heavy workload + strong opponents
reviews.comment_content:
This course intends to cover Internet applications development through programming (Java Programming). Major topics include object-oriented development approaches, advanced GUI building blocks, networking and database connectivity and so on. Students will learn and practice a high-level programming language for the implementation of practical Internet applications.

After this course, it would equip you with the basic skills to write a java program.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Generally, it is necessary to attend the lesson if you are BBA students without strong programming backgrounds.
The lessons will help you with your quiz and the lab will help you with your assignment and group projects.
reviews.comment_grading:
1 Assignment (due on 11th)      
   －15%  <- 1week after the lessons
2 Quizzes (15th and 25th) 30%
   －5% @1 <- MC questions only
3 Group project                          
   －40%  <- develop a java mini game
4 Attendance (Lab)                     
   －15% (7 out of 10 labs)

me first and second quiz below mean 1 mark
assignment below mean 0.x marks
project 9x/100
turnout ->B- so it is still fair grading
reviews.comment_workload:
Monday Wednesday Friday 10:00am - 5:00p.m
Don't reg 2 courses together(very heavy workload)
Each day finish 1-2 chapters (sometimes even 3 chapters)
so don't miss the class!

But it is okay that the project is submitted after the final quiz.
(during the first week of the spring semester)

reviews.author: 17ow01
reviews.title: Interesting and useful content but harsh grading
reviews.comment_content:
1. General Programming
    - Data and Variables
    - Flow Controls
    - Methods and Arrays
2. Object-Oriented Programming
    - Objects and Classes
    - Abstract Classes and Interfaces
    - Inheritance, Polymorphism
3. Developing Applications Using Java
    - GUI and Event Handling using
      JavaFX
    - Multimedia Programming and
      Exceptions Handling
    - Multi-Threading

Even though there are no pre-requisites, you really shouldn't do this course if you have no prior coding experience. As an absolute beginner, you will absolutely get destroyed in this course, as it covers so much content in so little time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is called Muller, and he is a pretty decent professor by UST standards. He has very clear and understandable English in my opinion, and his lectures are easy to follow. In class he basically just goes over the lecture notes. He always takes time to answer any questions that we have, which is great.

The TA, Samuel, is quite funny but still informative and makes lab sessions quite engaging. He knows the content very in-depth as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Practical submissions - 15%
Two assignments - 20%
Two in-class quizzes - 30%
Group project - 35%

For the practical submissions, you have to attend 8 out of 10 labs, and the TA will tell you what to submit at the end of the lab.

For the quizzes, the first one is only worth 10% and the second one is worth 20%. They are of decent difficulty contain some tricky questions that can mess with you.

You will spend the most time on the group project in this class. You basically have to create your own application, including graphical user interface and all. You can either choose your group, or you will be randomly assigned.

I think the grading is absolutely horrible and quite harsh. I got full marks for the practical submissions, 18/20 for the assignments, 10/15 for the first quiz, 18/23 for the second, and 31/35 for the group project, which is in total around 86%. My final grade was a C+.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload throughout. The assignments take quite some time, but the group project takes far more. You will have until the end of the first week of the spring term to finish it. If you take this course in winter, you should put all your effort and time into it.

reviews.author: Jayyy
reviews.title: Not recommended for those having little programming experience
reviews.comment_content: concise and comprehensive, covering the basic issues of java programming, like basic syntax review, polymorphism, javafx, exception, thread.
reviews.comment_teaching: humorous and relaxing teaching style, a bit of slow. Talking slow but concepts were skipping fast, not easy to catch up.
reviews.comment_grading:
fair enough, I got bad grade since my first assignment got major compile error(50% deducted in 15% course grade), mean score of assignment is around full mark, quizzes are around 17/21&15/22, project is meaned 8x% which is fair for the limited time.
I got mean scores for 2 quizzes and 95% in group project. So I could get a D/F if I had a mean score for group project LOL.
reviews.comment_workload: compress the fundamental knowledge of java/javafx to just 1 month to learn is just time-saving and a kick-start to your programming learning process. In other words, this is painful for those who has no experience in programming.

reviews.author: chioyboy
reviews.title: ISOM 3320: Internet Applications Developent: Misnomer!
reviews.comment_content: This is a possible course students can take to fulfill IS Major Requirements. Please be warned that the title is extremely misleading, as there is little emphasis on the Internet and instead heavy emphasis on Java programming, starting from absolute basics to object-oriented programming, JavaFX, text IO and exception handling.
reviews.comment_teaching:
On Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, lectures are from 10 AM to 3 PM with a lunch break from 12 PM to 1 PM, and tutorials from 3 PM to 5 PM.

ZHENG, Rong is a kind-hearted professor who engages the students well, making side conversations in the break. He also knows the subject matter well. However, he teaches rather slowly and could do with more emotion.

CHOI, Timture is a humorous TA who engages the students even better than the Professor in that Cantonese is spoken frequently in lab sessions coupled with many jokes. He definitely knows the subject very well and teaches straight to the point.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two quizzes each 15%, one assignment 15%, lab attendance (7/10) 15%, and a group project 40%.

Although grading is fair, be warned that the quizzes are worth a lot and only have 22 tricky questions each.

You will also only have about a week or so to finish the tumultuous project, so make haste.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you have little or no programming background, be prepared to work your balls off.

Although the professor may say you don't require the textbook, do find yourself a copy or electronic copy if you want to ensure that you understand the material.
